thread.title: Footballer 'thought 14-year-old girl was older when she sent topless photograph before alleged sex meeting in car'
thread.title_full: Footballer 'thought 14-year-old girl was older when she sent topless photograph before alleged sex meeting in car'

author: Richard Wheatstone
title: Footballer 'thought 14-year-old girl was older when she sent topless photograph before alleged sex meeting in car'
text:
Oldham Athletic midfielder Jack Tuohy is accused of child sex offences (Photo: Manchester Evening News) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A footballer believed a 14-year-old girl was above the age of consent when she sent him a topless selfie and met him in his car outside his club's football ground - a court has heard. 
Jack Tuohy, 20, is alleged to have groomed the girl before she allegedly performed a sex act on him in his Seat Ibiza at a secluded spot in Oldham, Greater Manchester. 
Touhy - who was 19 and played for Oldham Athletic at the time of the alleged offences - denies the charges against him and claims he believed the girl was at least 16. 
Paul Hodgkinson, defending Tuohy, put it to the girl that it was she rather than his client who initiated contact shortly after he handed out medals at her school's sports day. 
Manchester Minshull Street Crown Court heard the complainant had "liked" a number of photographs of the defendant which he posted on social media before the sports day - one dating back to 2013. Jack Tuohy denies all the charges (Photo: Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd) 
Giving evidence via videolink, the girl accepted she had liked the photographs but said that did not necessarily mean she did so before the tournament. 
Mr Hodgkinson said: "I am saying you knew who Jack Tuohy was before you met him at the football. In fact you had followed him ... and you liked a number of his photographs." 
The girl replied: "No, I didn't know who he was." 
Prosecutors claim Tuohy went on to groom the youngster, who sent him a topless selfie photograph, through social media before she performed a sex act on him in his Seat Ibiza car parked in a secluded location in Oldham. 
Opening the case, prosecutor Ben Jones had said the evidence would show the defendant "effectively bullied" the "starstruck" teenager into meeting up after she developed a crush on him. 
On Wednesday, the girl told the jury that she recalled telling the footballer on Snapchat that she was 14. Jack Tuohy is alleged to have groomed the girl before she allegedly performed oral sex on him (Photo: Cavendish Press) 
Mr Hodgkinson said to her: "I am going to suggest that conversation did not take place." 
She said: "It did." 
The barrister went on: "I am going to say you never told him how old you were." 
The witness replied: "I did." 
She agreed with Mr Hodgkinson that she had "told a little lie" about the date of birth on her Facebook page which put her at 17 years old. 
The girl also accepted her profile picture at the time made her appear older, and agreed she was "pouting a little bit". 
But she denied that she was trying to make herself look older than 14. 
Mr Hodgkinson accused her of concealing her age because she wanted to "keep hold" of Tuohy as a boyfriend. 
He said: "You never told Jack your real age." 
She said: "I did."Mr Hodgkinson continued: "You wanted to pretend to Jack that you were older than you actually were." 
She said: "No, I did not." Jack Tuohy outside Minshull Street Crown Court (Photo: Cavendish Press) 
She also disagreed that Tuohy had never asked her to send naked photographs of herself and that he had not sent her a picture of his penis. 
The court previously heard how Tuohy allegedly exchanged messages in the run up to the car meeting, which read: 
Tuohy: ''We will go somewhere I know and then I'm going to take you back. Stop messing me around you coming or not. Can't I just drive to near your house? Surely you know one place where no one goes? 
Girl: ''No I'm not allowed I will get grounded. I don't really meet lads in cars I'm not sure. I've met you before.'' 
Tuohy: ''Are you coming or not?'' 
Girl: ''This is my only chance isn't it? I don't want to do stuff if we just met.'' 
Tuohy: ''Wow so you're all talk wow. Don't speak to me again you're all talk.'' 
Girl: ''What would you want to do. I would do some stuff. S*ck you off. Probs. If you want.'' 
Tuohy: ''Best not tell one person. I'll wear something easy to get into like joggers haha. You better not back out. Just be confident. But tell no one. Just get in and just start feeling my d*** it will be fine. It will make you feel comfortable just start rubbing it on top of my pants and then go down while I drive.'' 
Tuohy, 20, of Arthur Street, Shaw, Oldham, denies two counts of engaging in sexual activity with a child, two counts of inciting a child to engage in sexual activity and one count of meeting a child following sexual grooming. Like us on Facebook
